bp_medicine_instruction: Don't forget to take your pills
cream_instruction: Don't forget to apply your cream
bactrium_instruction: Take a look at delicious healthy food
ibuprofen_instruction: Get to know yourself better and discover the best advice tailored just for you.
antihistamine_description:
Capsules with Curcuminoids – Natural Anti-inflammatories
Formulated from concentrated curcumin extracts, these capsules offer a natural solution to relieve chronic inflammatory pain (joints, muscles, digestion...). Thanks to their powerful antioxidant properties, they help strengthen the immune system, protect cells from oxidative stress, and improve daily comfort.
100% natural, with no chemical additives.

recipes.title: Turmeric Vegetable Soup
recipes.description: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté the onion and garlic until soft. Add the chopped carrots, potatoes, and zucchini, then pour in water or vegetable broth. Stir in turmeric, salt, and black pepper, and let the mixture simmer until the vegetables are tender. Blend the soup until smooth and serve warm.

recipes.title: Fruit Salad with Turmeric and Honey
recipes.description: Chop the fruits into small cubes. In a bowl, mix the fruit pieces with turmeric and honey. Serve chilled as a refreshing drink or a light dish.

recipes.title: Brown Rice with Turmeric
recipes.description: Heat olive oil in a pot and add the brown rice. Stir well with turmeric. Pour in water or broth, season with salt and black pepper, then cover and cook on low heat for 40-45 minutes until the rice is fully cooked.

recipes.title: Golden Milk (Turmeric Milk)
recipes.description: Heat the milk over low heat, then add turmeric, ginger, cinnamon, and black pepper. Stir well and let it simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, add honey, and serve warm.

recipes.title: Oat Bread with Turmeric
recipes.description: Mix all the ingredients until you get a firm dough. Shape the dough into small loaves and flatten them slightly. Place the loaves in the oven at 180°C for 15 minutes. Enjoy with soup or healthy cheese.

foodSuggestions.title: Vitamin D
foodSuggestions.description: Sources: sun exposure, egg yolk, cod liver, fortified milk.

foodSuggestions.title: Vitamin C (powerful antioxidant)
foodSuggestions.description: Sources: citrus fruits, strawberries, bell pepper, kiwi, parsley.

foodSuggestions.title: Zinc
foodSuggestions.description: Sources: seafood, meat, pumpkin seeds, lentils.

foodSuggestions.title: Magnesium
foodSuggestions.description: Sources: dark chocolate, banana, legumes, almonds, spinach.

foodSuggestions.title: Polyphenols (antioxidant compounds)
foodSuggestions.description: Sources: green tea, pure cocoa, berries, extra virgin olive oil.

foodSuggestions.title: High-quality proteins
foodSuggestions.description: Sources: eggs, fish, poultry, legumes, tofu.

foodSuggestions.title: Omega-3 (anti-inflammatory fatty acids)
foodSuggestions.description: Sources: fatty fish (salmon, sardine, mackerel), flaxseeds, walnuts, canola oil.

advices: Reduces inflammation and supports immunity thanks to curcumin

Improves absorption when consumed with black pepper or healthy fats
Consume in moderation as a spice in food, avoiding high doses without medical consultation

Medical follow-up is essential to avoid any interaction with treatments
A healthy lifestyle including balanced nutrition, exercise, and good sleep enhances benefits
Improves insulin sensitivity and helps stabilize blood sugar levels
Reduces inflammation and alleviates diabetes complications

Better absorbed when taken with black pepper or healthy fats
Regular blood sugar monitoring is necessary to avoid severe drops
Supports digestion and improves gut health
Incorporate into a healthy lifestyle for optimal benefits
Improves blood vessel function: Curcumin helps regulate blood pressure and reduces heart disease risk
Powerful antioxidant: Reduces inflammation and oxidative stress associated with heart disease
Supports heart health: Contains vitamin B6, which helps reduce the harmful effects of homocysteine on blood vessels
Moderate consumption: High doses may interact with certain medications, especially blood thinners, so consulting a doctor is advised
Improves absorption: Best consumed with black pepper or healthy fats like olive oil
Healthy lifestyle: Combining turmeric with a balanced diet, regular physical activity, and stress management enhances heart health
Reduces inflammation and supports kidney health when used wisely
Consume in moderation as a spice without overuse or concentrated supplements
Incorporate into a healthy diet that is low in potassium and rich in suitable vegetables
Better absorption when taken with healthy fats or black pepper
Regular medical follow-up is essential to monitor kidney function and prevent any negative effects
Adopt a healthy lifestyle by reducing sodium intake, exercising, and managing stress
Balance is key to gaining benefits without overloading the kidneys

cream_description:
1. Présentation de la crème

Nom du produit : Crème réparatrice au curcuma
Type : Soin naturel anti-inflammatoire et cicatrisant
Public ciblé : Peaux irritées, peaux sensibles, cicatrices récentes
2. Bienfaits principaux
Anti-inflammatoire : Grâce à la curcumine contenue dans l’huile essentielle de curcuma.
Cicatrisant : Le beurre de karité favorise la régénération cutanée.
Hydratant : L’huile de coco forme une barrière protectrice.
Apaisant : L’huile essentielle de lavande calme les irritations et les démangeaisons.
Antibactérien naturel : Idéal pour prévenir les infections cutanées.

3. Conseils d’utilisation
Appliquer matin et/ou soir sur une peau propre et sèche.
Masser doucement en mouvements circulaires.
Non-comédogène, peut être utilisée sur le visage (en petite quantité).
5. Précautions d’emploi
Test cutané recommandé avant la première utilisation.
Ne pas appliquer sur une plaie ouverte ou infectée.
Éviter le contour des yeux et les muqueuses.
Déconseillé aux femmes enceintes/allaitantes sans avis médical.
Conserver à l’abri de la lumière et de la chaleur.
cream_1desc:
Product name: Turmeric Repair Cream
Type: Natural anti-inflammatory and healing skincare
Target audience: Irritated skin, sensitive skin, recent scars
cream_2desc: Anti-inflammatory thanks to curcumin contained in turmeric essential oil. Healing with shea butter that promotes skin regeneration. Moisturizing due to coconut oil that forms a protective barrier. Soothing thanks to lavender essential oil that calms irritation and itching. Natural antibacterial, ideal for preventing skin infections.
cream_3desc: Apply morning and/or evening to clean, dry skin. Gently massage in circular motions. Non-comedogenic, can be used on the face in small amounts.
cream_4desc: Skin test recommended before first use. Do not apply to open or infected wounds. Avoid the eye area and mucous membranes. Not recommended for pregnant or breastfeeding women without medical advice. Store away from light and heat.
